Longer words are worth more, so extend your roots as long as you like, but watch out!  Any root still on the table can be stolen by another player if they can extend it. (from the rulebook)

Letter Cards Deck (104 cards)
Turn Summary Cards Deck (6 cards)
Rules Document

Name: Loto-Leitura
Description: A word lotto game, intended to teach young children simple spelling of short words. Players draw and collect letter tiles at random, attempting to form the words printed on their boards. Several variants are included.

Name: Italy Awakes
Description:
Italy Awakes: The Birth of a Nation 1848-1859

This is a simple and very playable simulation of the Italian Wars for Independence, the First and the Second, with 2 scenarios (1848 and 1859), for
two players, but also playable solitaire without significant problems. It can be completed in under 3 hours of play, with enough beef to interest even
the grognard, but mostly for the newcomers to the hobby.

Each game turn is 10 days of real time and each unit represents around 3/4000 soldiers. In the tradition of our previous effort, Prussia Rising, Italy awakes is more a game than an historical
simulation, but we still think that playing it could be a fun way to learn a little more about such an important period for the history of Italy, Europe
and the world.

Contains:
5 Pages of Rules
63 x 29cm Map (in 3 parts)
395 Counters

Name: Alias DVD
Description:
From the publisher:
Play now super popular Alias Word Explanation game in your living room with Marco Bjurström! The game includes a familiar word explanation of the tasks, but this time there is also an interactive DVD, where the rules of the game are "Marco says", to explain the words, and gymnastics to pull a break to surprise the players in many different ways along the play. Players guess word while doing what Marko tells them do to. Alias DVD represents a completely new gaming club form and is part of every modern home gaming classic!

Name: Bravo Gorilla
Description:
Freely translated (and slightly expanded) from the Italian "Dictionary of Boardgames" ("Dizionario dei Giochi di Società"):

Two tribes of primates vie for control of the jungle. Game similar to Stratego: players have 16 gorillas each, of different values hidden from the view of the opponent. Aim of the game is capturing the opponent's king.
 Contents: board, 16 red gorillas, 16 blue gorillas, rules booklet.

Name: Greenline
Description:
Greenline is a roll and move game that represents the moving of the resources of a large corporation around the world. Players compete to get to the end of the board first...

However, unlike a simple roll and move game, there are some interesting wrinkles. Each player uses a different mode of transport: airplane, train, truck, or boat. Each mode allows a player to avoid a hazard or gain an advantage in a particular situation that may or may not come up during any particular session. At the beginning of the game, the player who rolls highest gets to choose their mode of transport, followed by the next highest rolling player, etc. Each mode uses a different color pawn.

Also, players have the option of rolling for one of 5 special attributes at the beginning of the game. These attributes - 1. invoice, 2. letter of credit, 3. customs documents, 4. freight insurance, & 5. the goods... are not exclusive to any one player and are randomly determined. A player may roll as many times as they like for these attributes (which can potentially prevent setbacks or lend an advantage), but once they've started moving on the board, they are not allowed to roll for any more attributes. Players must balance a desire for having as many attributes as possible with the notion of getting moving on the board.

The main path on the board (also the shortest path) is the Greenline of the title. However, if players land on certain squares they must roll a die to see if they are diverted onto a red circuit. This creates a delay as the player must go through a side path that usually has other negative encounter possibilities. There are also a number of yellow spaces on the board that represent random challenges which require the player to have one of the special attributes to avoid a penalty or to gain an advantage.

This game appears to have been developed by Philips to build teamwork or to encourage employees to think in terms of working as efficiently as possible. Apparently this game only appeared in Dutch.

Name: ASL British AFV Vehicle Cards
Description:
This expansion for Advanced Squad Leader provides the British forces of West of Alamein: ASL Module 5 a set of 24 "AFV cards".  Each card represents an AFV (armored fighting vehicle) type and has counter marker tracks for up to a platoon of such vehicles.  Markers for armor leaders, malfunctions and special equipment could thus be off board, allowing for less clutter on the mapboard units.

Common in miniature game systems, vehicle tracking cards in ASL first appeared for German and Soviet forces in Streets of Fire: ASL Deluxe Module 1 and then for American  forces in Hedgerow Hell: ASL Deluxe Module 2, both encouraging the use of 1/285th scale armor miniatures as mapboard units.

Use of the cards does not impact the AFV rule set, it is simply a record keeping enhancement.  In particular, these cards are not meant to provide a means of hidden information, as the rules specifically require the AFV status to be displayed at all times to the opponent.  Thus, for example, hidden armor leaders are still be noted somewhere off of the cards.

Page F18 of Chapter F provided in West of Alamein: ASL Module 5 stated: "British AFV Cards will become available for purchase as of January 1989.  Their cost will be $5.00 US, plus 10% for shipping within the USA (or for APO/FPO); or 20% for Canada or Mexico; or 30% for shipment overseas."

Name: Hot Numbers
Description:
a sizzling game of Fun.
for young and old , keep's em popping with excitement.
this set accommodates two, three or four players. add additional sets for larger groups.game is comprised of 60 blocks, ten of which are the "hot numbers" ranging from 100 to 600. the remaing blocks are assorted in 5's, 10's, 15's, 25's and 50's.
instructions from side of can:

Play begins with all tiles face down and each player drawing 15, taking a brief look at them, and returning them to the table face down in front of the player who drew them. Here they are again mixed up so the player doesn't know which tile is where. Based on what they saw in their sneak peak players make a bid as to how many points they believe they'll earn throughout the course of the round. Each player then blindly turns over one of his or her tiles and the highest number played takes that turn.

After all tiles have been played, the points are tabulated to see how each player did in relation to his or her bid. After a round of play, players may find their score increased or decreased. They may earn either the number of points taken in or the number of points taken in plus the amount of their bid. Or, if they are unlucky and do not make the amount of their bid, will find their overall score decreased by the amount of their bid. Play continues round by round until one player has earned 10,000 points.

above info from side of tin.

Name: WordSaic
Description:
From the front of the instruction book: "A mosaic is traditionally the creation of a design by the combination of components. Wordsaic combines components of words in a new and unusual way to provide a mosaic of words and pictures."

In WordSaic, players solve word problems in order to complete their collection of mosaic tiles.  Roll the dice to determine which clue you receive and solve the multi-part clue.  Each part of the clue gives players a hint at one or two syllables of the solution word.

Example clue: "5th letter of the alphabet, cut the grass, lower leg"

Solution word: "EMOTION" (e - mow - shin)

Name: Top Dog
Description:
Two player dexterity game of launching balls into a playing area where planes 'catch' the balls and fall to the ground.  The box is part of the game itself and the action is fast and fun.

From the box...

"The Dog-Fightin' Action Game!"

Ready, Aim, Fire Away!  You've got to get your opponent's planes before he gets yours.  Load your ammo, line up your planes and you're ready to play.  Keep firing and reloading until your opponent's squadron is knocked out.  At last, the battle is won and you're Top Dog!

Name: Rich Making Board Game
Description: This is a discount priced Korean children's roll-n-move game sold at Daiso stores.  The gameplay is similar to The Game of Life.  Players move around a brightly colored board at one of four stand-up figures.  The players collect cards that will be used to score the player's fortunes at the end of the game.  The player with the greatest fortune at the end is the winner.

Name: Dinosaurs Adventure Board Game
Description: A budget priced Korean roll-and-move game.  Part of the infamous Daiso 3000won series. The game has a format similar to monopoly.  Players movie around the outside of the board collecting money and dinosaur cards while trying to avoid the other player's dinosaur spaces.  There is also a "shortcut" on on courner of the board that players may use if given the right roll.

Name: Der reimende Sprechdachs
Description:
Der Reimende Sprechdachs is a compilation of games played with 72 different cards, 36 pairs that show rhyming (in German) things.

The first game is a memory-variation, the second is a quartett-variation.
In another game, all card are placed face up, one player chooses a picture each turn, and the others try to find the rhyming word as fast as they can.

Name: Squirrel Squabble
Description:
In Squirrel Squabble, a player must outguess, outmaneuver, and outsmart his opponent to be the first squirrel to gather five nuts and return home.

This free print-and-play game consists of just a single page of components to build. Nine double-sided tiles are used to form a tight, 3x3 playing grid on which the squirrels move to try to gather nuts. Each player also has six double-sided action tiles, which are used to simultaneously program three actions per round. These actions allow the players not only to move, but also to change the makeup of the board, battle the opposing squirrel, and even change the opponent's actions!

Name: Atlanta-Opoly
Description:
How do you make a board game about the city of Atlanta?
While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed as much Atlanta as we could into this box. It’s FULL of history, parks, SPORTS, just one more peach AND...LOTS OF fun! LOOKING FOR A Great WAY TO EXPERIENCE A-Town? HERE IT IS! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round! Here's a quick idea of how to play!
Buy your favorite Atlanta properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy?

WELL, ADD IN SOME TRAFFIC JAMS, Property Tax
AND PARKING FINES AND IT GETS A LITTLE
MORE DIFFICULT AND A LOT MORE FUN!

SO CHOOSE YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GOATLANTA!
YOU MAY SOON BE THE MAYOR OF Atlanta...
OR YOU MAY BE STUCK IN THE
TRAFFIC JAM OF YOUR LIFE!
Get YOUR Game On!
THIS IS ATLANTA... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!!

Publisher's Website

Name: Boston-opoly
Description:
There are a few cities that grab hold of the heart almost at first sight. Boston is one of those cities. Its range and depth of history are unequaled, but Boston has a youthful spirit. Skyscrapers of tomorrow stand respectfully alongside cherished symbols of yesterday. Built by people from every corner of the world, great ethnic influence has created unique neighborhoods, and the city thrives on its diversity. This is a city with character that rivals any challenger. The sun rises on Boston - and she shines!

While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Boston we could into this box! It’s full of swans, ships, marathons, Boston Terriers, sports and of course...CHOWDER! Looking for a fun way to experience Bean Town? Here it is!

Here’s a quick idea of how to play... Buy your favorite Boston properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, throw in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a A LOT more fun!

So choose your token and advance to Paul Revere! You may soon be the Mayor of Boston... or you may be stuck in the traffic jam of your life!

GET YOUR GAME ON! This is Boston... and it’s YOUR roll!

Publisher's Website

Name: Chicago-opoly
Description:
How do you make a game about the second city?

While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the CHICAGO we could into this box. It’s FULL OF BLUES, PIZZA, SPORTS, A LITTLE MORE PIZZA AND...LOTS OF WIND! LOOKING FOR A FUN WAY TO EXPERIENCE THE WINDY CITY? HERE IT IS!

Here’s a Quick Idea of How to Play... Buy your favorite Chicago properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and A LOT more fun!

So choose your token and advance to Go Chicago! You may soon be the mayor of Chicago... or you may be stuck in the traffic jam of your life! Get your game on!

This is Chi-town... and it’s your roll!

Publisher's Website

Name: Kalle Anka & Co Korsordsspel
Description:
This is, more or less, a dice version of Scrabble without the board. The game consists of 12 dice with a letter on each side (and a score). When it's your turn you roll all dice and build a "crossword" using as many of the dice as possible, and then sum up your score.

The game was distributed as a freebie with an issue of the Swedish edition of Donald Duck magazine sometime in the very late 1990s or early 2000s.

Name: Cincinnati-opoly
Description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Cincinnati! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some chili cheese coneys, a few flying pigs, great traditions, riverboats, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; CINCINNATI-OPOLY!

Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Cincinnati! It's Your Roll!

Publisher's Website

Name: Dallas-opoly
Description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Dallas! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some western heritage, a huge ferris wheel, a little chili, a great big cowboy, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; DALLAS-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Dallas! It's Your Roll!

Name: Denver-opoly
Description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Denver! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some Rocky Mountains, professional sports, music, a great big ampitheatre, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; Denver-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Denver! It's Your Roll!

Publisher's Website

Name: Indianapolis-opoly
Description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Indianapolis! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some super fast Indy cars, higher education, a great big Monument Circle, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; INDIANAPOLIS-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Indianapolis! It's Your Roll!

Publisher's Website

Name: Kansas City-opoly
Description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Kansas City! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some splendid fountains, awesome parks, the arts, world-famous BBQ, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; Kansas city-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Kansas City! It's Your Roll!

Publisher's Website
